definition: to pass through one's hands/to handle/to deal with
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: We were very impressed by your handling of this affair.
sentences.chinese: 你经手处理这问题的方法给我们留下了深刻的影响。

sentences.english: These dumplings come courtesy of a Taiwanese restaurant chain called Din Tai Fung No matter.
sentences.chinese: 现在经手的是台湾一家名叫鼎泰丰的连锁店。

sentences.english: To hand, some of it inevitably sticks to the fingers that it touches.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款几经转手，必然有一部分被经手人染指。

sentences.english: It does not pay its handlers.
sentences.chinese: 经手此事的人无利可图。

sentences.english: They are kept always in an acid pH when in responsible hands.
sentences.chinese: 在负责任的人经手时，它们总是被饲养于酸性水里。

sentences.english: Working days start from the date receiving this form.
sentences.chinese: 以经手人收到申请单之日期为工作天之起算日。
我只要求一点经手之劳。
该律师经手承办这宗案件。
他们没有付给我们经手费。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To check the residue of surgical instruments after manual washing.
sentences.chinese: 目的检测常规经手刷清洗后的手术器械有无残留血渍。

definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
